TITLE.P: Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) expert of Countering the Financing of Terrorism/Anti-Money Laundering (CFT/AML) project based in Beirut

SHORT_DESCR.P: Under the supervision and guidance of Expertise France and the Team Leader, the FIU expert will be responsible for the identification of needs and opportunities related to local FIUs. He/She will maintain a working relationship with local authorities and supervise the execution of activities designed during the inception phase.

MAIN_SITE.P: Based in Beirut, the project covers the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) and South East Asia (SEA) regions. The FIU expert will be covering the MENA region.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Description of the tasks to be assigned:
— Participate in the inception phase of the project, and in the elaboration of a working plan specifically in the field of FIUs,

— Network with relevant stakeholders in partner countries and maintain a working relationship with local administrations, and relevant regional and international organisations related to FIU subjects,
— Ensure regular high-quality reporting on project activities to project management and donor,
— Draft in collaboration with other experts mission reports, the annual progress report and the final report specifically in the field of FIUs,
— Any other task requested by Expertise France for the CFT/AML project.
—— Mapping of existing initiatives and stakeholders/Needs assessment/gap analysis in the field of FIUs,
—— Workplan, which includes a prioritization in the implementation of the project and a list of activities to be implemented, in the field of FIUs.
—— Annual reports (narrative description of the year activities and update of the workplan for the year ahead),
—— Any additional deliverables requested by DG DEVCO / EF in relation to the CFT/AML project.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The initial contract is for a duration of 12 months from the date of entry into force of the contract. It is renewable three times for the same period. The total duration of the contracts shall not exceed 48 months.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: Application criteria in order to establish the short list (100 points):
— Relevance of education background in terms of knowledge of counter-terrorism issues (5 points).
— Ability to evolve in a political and sensitive environment (15 points),
— Relevance of experience working in a team (10 points),
— Competency levels in financial intelligence/ anti-money laundering (20 points),
— Level of experience working in collaboration with Ministries of Justice and/or Ministries of Finance (10 points),
— Level of experience working in an international environment (10 points),
— Experience in EU Project Cycle Management (5 points),
— Relevance of experience in the MENA (5 points).

OBJECT_DESCR.EU_PROGR_RELATED: Countering the Financing of Terrorism/Anti-Money Laundering (CFT/AML) project

SUITABILITY.P: 2. Evidence of the company registration (legal personality of the expert) in the case of a Contract for the Provision of Services

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: — University degree (BA or MA or equivalent) in law, political science, economics or any other relevant discipline;
— Fluent in spoken and written English and French;
— A minimum of 8 years of experience working in financial intelligence/anti-money laundering;
— Experience working in collaboration with Ministries of Justice and Ministries of Finance;
— A minimum of 3 years of professional experience in a Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU);
— Experience working in the Middle East and North Africa.

INFO_ADD.P: Applicable regulation: French Ordonnance nº 2015-899 of 23.7.2015 and implementing Decree nº 2016-360 of 25.3.2016 (articles 71, 72 and 73).

The procedure will take place in 2 stages. The candidate is invited to submit his expression of interest to the tender within the time limit indicated by the present notice. For the next step, unless a candidate express formerly his disagreement, the tendering period shall last 10 days. Shortlisted experts will then be invited to take part in interviews. Only experts who provided the documentation as set forth in section III will be assessed on the basis of their capacity to fulfil the tasks set out in this call for expressions of interest.

The overall objective of the cooperation project is to cut off individual terrorists and terrorist organizations access to funding and introduce enhanced measures against serious organized crimes in specific regions (MENA, S-SEA) through support to increase compliance with FATF recommendations and relevant UNSCRs. The general purpose of this project is to increase awareness towards AML/CFT issues, foster the analytical and operational capacity and encourage the cooperation opportunities of the financial and criminal justice actors at a national, regional and international levels to ensure better AML/CFT efficiency.

More specifically, the project will aim to enhance national and regional CFT/AML capacities by addressing the gaps in the penal chain and to increase national, regional and international cooperation by supporting or creating networks and partnerships.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_INFO.OFFICIALNAME: Registry of the Paris Administrative Court
